gurmukhi: BwKw suB sB krhoN DirhoN kiR`q mY ]
transliteration: Bhaakhaa Soubh Sabh Kar-hon Dharihon Kritt Mai||
translation: In this composition, I shall use the beautiful language;

gurmukhi: AdBuq kQw Apwr smJ kir ic`q mY ]6]
transliteration: Abhout Kathaa Apaar Samajh Kar(i) Chitt Mai||6||
translation: And whatever I have thought in my mind, I shall narrate that wonderful story.6.

gurmukhi: qRws kutMb ky hoie kY audws Avws ko iqAwig bisE bnrweI ]
transliteration: Traas Koutanb Ke Hoe Kai Udaas Avaas Ko Tiaag(i) Basio Banraaoo||
translation: Dejected on account of the tragic happening in the family, he deserted his home and came to live in the forest.

gurmukhi: nwm sur`Q munIsr byK smyq smwd smwD lgweI ]
transliteration: Naam Suratth Manoosar Bekh Samet Samaad Samaadh Lagadoo||
translation: His name was Surath and adopting the garb of sages, he engaged himself in contemplation.

gurmukhi: cMf AKMf KMfy kr kop BeI sur r`Cn ko smuhweI ]
transliteration: Channd Akhannddkhande Kar Kop Bhaoo Sur Rachchhan Ko Samuhaaoo||
translation: The goddess Chandika of perfect brilliance is there before all, She is the destroyer of demons and Protector of gods.

gurmukhi: bUJhu jwie iqnY qum swD AgwiD kQw ikh BwNiq sunweI ]7]
transliteration: Boodheoh Jaae Tinai Toum Saadh Agaddh(i) Kathaa Kih Bhaant(i) Sounaaoo||7||
translation: The sage Surath told his companion sage, “O hermit, try to comprehend now, what his marvelous story it is?”7.

gurmukhi: hir soie rhY sj sYn qhw ]jl jwl krwl ibswl jhw ]
transliteration: Har(i) Soe Rahai Saj Sain Tahaa|| Jal Jaal Karaaal Bidaal Jahaa||
translation: The Lord was sleeping on an adorned bed, within the terrible and vast expanse of water.

gurmukhi: BXo nwB sroj qy ibsu krqw ]sRuq mYl qy dYq rcy jugqw ]8]
transliteration: Bhayo Naabh Daroj Te Bis(u) Kartaa|| Srout Mail Te Dait Rache Jougtaa||8||
translation: From His navel-lotus Brahma was born, with some device, the demons were created from the dross of His ear.8.

gurmukhi: miDkYtB nwm Dry iqn ky ]Aiq dIrG dyh Bey ijn ky ]
transliteration: Madhikaitabh Naam Ddare Tin Ke|| At(i) Dooragh Deh Bhae Jin Ke||
translation: They were named as Madhu and Kaitabh, their bodies were enormously great.

gurmukhi: iqn dyK lukys firE hIA mY ]jgmwq ko iDAwnu DrXo jIA mY ]9]
transliteration: Tin Dekh Loukes Dario Hooa Mai|| Jagmaat Ko Dhiaan(u) Ddaryo Jooa Mai||9||
translation: Seeing them, Brahma became fearful, He contemplated in his mind on the universal mother.9.
